title.value: Comparison of Neural Network Training Methods for Brachytherapy Treatment Planning in Cervical Cancer
title.justification: The title is derived from the main objective stated in the paper, which is to compare three methods of neural network training for brachytherapy treatment planning in cervical cancer.
title.quote: The goal of this work was to compare three methods of neural network training: (1) a single model trained on all applicator data, (2) transfer learning (TL) of the combined model to each applicator, and (3) individual applicator models - in order to determine the optimal method for accurate dose prediction.

extractions.description: The paper investigates three neural network training methods for automated dose predictions in cervical cancer brachytherapy treatment, comparing a single model trained on all data, transfer learning, and individual applicator models to find the best method for accurate dose prediction.

type.justification: The paper describes an empirical study involving the training and evaluation of neural network models on a dataset of treatment plans to compare different training methods.
type.quote: Materials and Methods: Neural network models were produced for four applicator types - TO, TO with 1-7 needles (TON), tandem-and-ring (TR) and TR with 1-4 needles (TRN). First, a single model was trained on all applicator data using 907 treatment plans from 273 cervical cancer patients treated from 2010 onwards.

name.justification: The paper focuses on neural network models for dose prediction in cervical cancer brachytherapy treatment planning.
name.quote: Purpose: 3D neural network dose predictions have been shown to be useful for automating tandem-and-ovoid (TO) brachytherapy treatment planning for cervical cancer.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses dose prediction and treatment planning for brachytherapy in cervical cancer.
name.quote: Purpose: 3D neural network dose predictions have been shown to be useful for automating tandem-and-ovoid (TO) brachytherapy treatment planning for cervical cancer.

name.justification: The study involves neural network models, which are a core aspect of deep learning techniques.
name.quote: The goal of this work was to compare three methods of neural network training: (1) a single model trained on all applicator data, (2) transfer learning (TL) of the combined model to each applicator, and (3) individual applicator models - in order to determine the optimal method for accurate dose prediction.

name.justification: The model architecture, 3D Cascade U-Net, was explicitly mentioned as the network used in the study.
name.quote: A 3D Cascade U-Net with a mean squared error (MSE) loss function was used.

is_contributed.justification: The paper contributes this specific model architecture for the task discussed.
is_contributed.quote: A 3D Cascade U-Net with a mean squared error (MSE) loss function was used.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the experiment for training and evaluation with the dataset.
is_executed.quote: Neural network models were produced for four applicator types - TO, TO with 1-7 needles (TON), tandem-and-ring (TR) and TR with 1-4 needles (TRN).

is_compared.justification: This model is compared across different training methodologies as one of the core objectives of the research.
is_compared.quote: The goal of this work was to compare three methods of neural network training...
